page.title: 05Industry
page.content: The main industry in the area lies in the{British Aerospace}manuacturing complex.It is situated half way up St.Georges Hill,with an area of nearly 1 sq.km. It employs approximately 3950 people, most of whom work on manufacturing and technical drawing or design.The Weybridge division of B.A.E receives no complete projects,as there is no runway to remove the aircraft by. Consequently the plant only receives off-load work and incomplete projects from other plants.Component parts are manufactured at Weybridge and delivered by road and rail to the main manufacturing plants. The Weybridge plant is now converting to component work.This entails using more non-metallic substances which are much lighter than conventional metals like titanium and aluminium.This means that the end
